1. Unplug all Glorious mouse cables & receivers.
2. Plug in the mouse you'd like to pair via USB cable. Plug in the wireless receiver.
3. Select the mouse being paired from the utility below.
4. When both the USB and wireless receiver have been reconnected, click the Pair button.

Select a Mouse Button, above, to see its keybinding options.

A mouse button must be assigned as Layer Shift on the 
Standard layer under “Mouse Function” in order to access 
the second layer of functionality.

Selecting ‘New Macro’ will open the macro creation 
modal. Inside, you can choose the type of macro you 
want to create, set a name, and record & edit your inputs.

Saving from within the modal will add it to the list on 
the left.
Saving from within the modal will add it to the macro list.
Use the slider to set the point where any keypress will activate.
Selecting the button below will allow you to edit the actuation point on a per key basis.

Making a selection from the adjacent list will apply the 
respective lighting effect to the products you have 
connected. 

Different effects have different customization parameters.

Choose your desired type of macro to begin. 
You can change this at anytime.

A No Repeat macro performs once per activation of
where it is assigned.

Upon activation, a Toggle macro performs continuously
until activated a seconded time.

The assigned macro will perform continuously for as long 
as it’s assigned trigger is held down.

Please connect all required devices via USB to perform the firmware update.
Do not unplug your (mouse) cable and receiver or restart the app!
Do not unplug your (keyboard) cable or restart the app!
Some updates will un-pair the receiver from the mouse.
To restore wireless connectivity, please re-pair your receiver using the Pairing Utility.
The device's wireless receiver appears to be disconnected.
Please check your wireless receiver and try again.
A new Firmware version is available for these devices
Please ensure both your mouse and receiver are plugged in.
Do not unplug your (mouse) cable and receiver or restart the app!
The update installer has been started
Please unplug and then turn off your mouse using the on/off switch on the bottom.
While holding down the scroll wheel button, touch the mouse to the receiver and turn it on.
Continue holding the scroll wheel button for approximately 4 seconds until the LEDs blink green.
You can now use your mouse wirelessly.
Ensure you have stable internet connection before trying again.
to Glorious ID in order to access cloud profiles!
Input latency is the amount of time that passes between sending an electrical signal and the occurrence of a corresponding action.
Exporting a profile allows you to save custom settings. Importing a profile will allow you to apply custom settings from that profile. You can have up to three profiles in CORE at once.

Polling Rate is how often your OS checks for input.
This is a factor in determining the maximum input latency
of key presses. A high polling rate takes up more CPU
resources than lower polling rates.
Rotary Sensitivity controls the adjust increment between each step.
The device will not go into standby mode regardless of the global standby timer.
The device will adhere to the global standby timer setting.
The device standby timer will be independent of the global standby timer.
Lift-off Distance is how far the mouse sensor has to be from the valueJ or surface to stop tracking.
Debounce Time is a delay in detecting clicks after an initial click.

Motion Sync optimizes mouse tracking by 
synchronizing sensor and USB polling events.
Select this option so that you can further specify when and where your debounce timers are triggered. All debounce options are applied to all buttons on the mouse.
Change the name of your macro and access this information at anytime.
Access the Macro Type selection menu.
Use this button to start and pause the macro keystroke recording.
Selecting between Set Time or As Recorded allows you to either automatically set consistent delays between inputs, or record/adjust manually.
Adjust debounce delay at the exact moment you begin pressing or have fully pressed the mouse button.
Adjust debounce delay at the exact moment you begin releasing, or have fully released the mouse button.
Adjust debounce delay at the exact moment you have lifted and placed the mouse back down on the surface.
